solution.text:
Volume of cylinder \(= \pi r^2 \times h = \pi \times _{k}_^2 \times _{j}_ = _{{pi_val*(k**2)*j}}_ cm^3\)
Volume of new cuboid = \(lbh\) = Volume of cylinder
Therefore, \(lbh = \pi \times _{k}_^2 \times _{j}_ cm^3\)
\(\Rightarrow _{l}_ \times _{m}_ \times h = _{{pi_val*(k**2)*j}}_ cm^3\)
\(\Rightarrow h = \frac {\pi \times _{k}_^2 \times _{j}_}{_{l}_ \times _{m}_} = _{{trunc((pi_val*(k**2)*j)/(l*m), 2)}}_\)
The new cuboid is _{{trunc((pi_val*(k**2)*j)/(l*m), 2)}}_ cm tall

content.text: A metal cylinder of height _{j}_ cm and radius _{k}_ cm is melted and reshaped into a cuboid of length _{l}_ cm and breadth _{m}_ cm. No metal was wasted during this process. How tall is the new cuboid? (in cm)
